author: rjected
content: One of the things I'd be interested in knowing is why proposers / builders will adopt ePBS, meaning why they will deprecate mev-boost

author: rjected
content:
Also interesting would be:
* a description of the consensus bugs that have been mentioned / alluded to (I just read the "ePBS is a bug fix" discussion)
* other possible solutions for those bugs, and
* the argument for why ePBS is favorable in comparison to the alt solutions

author: terencechain
content: I think I made some good arguments here in the section `Relayer and builder relationship` on why builders will like ePBS more than having to go through relayer. Not having to "trust or purchase trust" from the relayer is a really big difference. https://terencechain.substack.com/p/why-you-should-care-about-epbs

author: terencechain
content: There's also a section for proposer's perspective

author: potuz
content: Lol, found another stupid bug: we weren't committing to the slot in the inclusion list summary signature, so any builder could include a previously signed empty inclusion list by a proposer and not use any. This may actually be an issue for 7547 too (don' t remember if the slot was added to that spec withing the signed data or not)

author: terencechain
content: Ya that's definitely the case for 7547 too

author: potuz
content: I don' t think so, the current PR by Mike has the slot committed to the signed data

author: potuz
content: It also has the parent hash committed to, which would also solve this

author: potuz
content: we don' t commit to the parent hash, but probably is a good idea to do so too, I just wanted to avoid the 32 extra bytes being broadcast in the global topic
